snippet: Two experimental gonorrhea treatments are nearly 100 percent effective but have harsh side effects, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention said.
abstract: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention reports that two experimental gonorrhea treatments are nearly 100 percent effective but have harsh side effects and should be reserved for patients allergic to current first-line therapy.
lead_paragraph: Two experimental gonorrhea treatments are nearly 100 percent effective but have harsh side effects, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention said.

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
